extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 2 teaspoons white truffle oil or extra-virgin olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalName: white truffle oil or extra-virgin olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: smoked salmon
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 pound thinly sliced smoked salmon, cut into 1/4-inch-wide strips
extendedIngredients.originalName: thinly sliced smoked salmon, cut into 1/4-inch-wide strips

title: Arugula and Pea Shoot Salad with Smoked Salmon
summary: Arugulan and Pea Shoot Salad with Smoked Salmon might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe serves 4. One portion of this dish contains about 11g of protein, 4g of fat, and a total of 108 calories. For $7.75 per serving, this recipe covers 17% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe from Food and Wine has 1 fans. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. Head to the store and pick up arugula, celery root, lemon juice, and a few other things to make it today. With a spoonacular score of 83%, this dish is awesome. Try Smoked Salmon and Arugula Salad, Bbq Onion And Smoked Gouda Quesadillas With Pea Shoot Mini Salad, and Bbq Onion and Smoked Gouda Quesadillas with Pea Shoot Mini Salad for similar recipes.
instructions: In a small bowl, mix the lemon juice with the truffle oil and season with salt and pepper. Set aside until ready to use.                                              Using a mandoline, slice the celery root very thinly. Stack the slices and cut them into very fine strips.                                               In a large bowl, toss the arugula with the pea shoots, celery root and smoked salmon. Add the dressing and toss well. Mound the salad on plates and serve.

steps.step: In a small bowl, mix the lemon juice with the truffle oil and season with salt and pepper. Set aside until ready to use.
Using a mandoline, slice the celery root very thinly. Stack the slices and cut them into very fine strips.
In a large bowl, toss the arugula with the pea shoots, celery root and smoked salmon.
Add the dressing and toss well. Mound the salad on plates and serve.
